pullRequest.title: improve startup performance for clojure apps
pullRequest.bodyText: Reorganising ignores matcher into a switch statement led to >25% improvement in clojure koans/leiningen.

beforeCommit.message: mke it possible to configurably skip transformation of any clojure class

afterCommit.message: mke it possible to configurably skip transformation of any clojure class

nodes.bodyText: Can't you do a break here as well as in the other non matching ones?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -47,129 +47,145 @@ private GlobalIgnoresMatcher(final boolean skipAdditionalLibraryMatcher) {
   @Override
   public boolean matches(final T target) {
     final String name = target.getActualName();
-
-    if (name.startsWith("datadog.opentracing.")
-        || name.startsWith("datadog.trace.core.")
-        || name.startsWith("datadog.slf4j.")
-        || name.startsWith("net.bytebuddy.")
-        || name.startsWith("jdk.")
-        || name.startsWith("org.aspectj.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.intellij.rt.debugger.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.p6spy.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.newrelic.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.dynatrace.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.jloadtrace.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.appdynamics.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.singularity.")
-        || name.startsWith("com.jinspired.")
-        || name.startsWith("org.jinspired.")) {
-      return true;
+    switch (name.charAt(0) - 'a') {
+        // starting at zero to get a tableswitch from javac, though it looks horrendous
+      case 'a' - 'a':
+      case 'b' - 'a':

nodes.bodyText: what happens if the case doesn't start with 0?
can these all fall through to the last break?  (does the break need to be duplicated?)
